results.title: The Diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Brooklyn Juvenile Guidance Centre
results.brief_description: Traces the step-by-step procedure of screening clinical data in order to establish the diagnosis of childhood schizophrenia: a process involving a review of the pertinent historical material, psychological test findings, clinical observations, and the noting of the absence of significant medical, neurological, and laboratory test results, followed by a differential diagnosis to rule out clinical syndromes with which childhood schizophrenia is commonly confused.

results.title: Diagnosing group operations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Uses demonstrations and discussion to consider the causes of problems that arise in groups: signs of conflict, withdrawal, factionalism, and group indecision, along with their crippling effect on the life of the group. Explains how to identify symptoms of group problems.

results.title: Developmental evaluation in infancy
results.brief_description: Part I shows developmental mechanisms involved in adaptive and fine motor behavior and traces the evolution of behavior from 4 weeks to 15 months. Part II shows developmental mechanism involved in gross motor behavior and traces the evolution of behavior from 4 weeks to 15 months.

Part II shows developmental mechanism involved in gross motor behavior and traces the evolution of behavior from 4 weeks to 15 months.

results.title: Developmental aspects of play
results.brief_description: A baby learns through a happy relationship with its mother and through play. For children, play is actually work - it is an index to the child’s physical, emotional and intellectual development. Comments on various developmental stages and gives advice on toys and child handling.

results.title: The Development of transportation
results.creator_credit: Electrical Research Products, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A study of the development of transportation in the USA during the past 150 years. The spread of railway and highway networks over the geographical barriers of the continent, and the principle stages of the development of the locomotive and automobile engines are dealt within detail; air transport, and its potentialities form the final part of this survey.

results.title: Development of the Chick
results.brief_description: The structure of the egg is examined and the early development and growth of the embryo. Hatching is seen and subsequent growth of the chick to maturity.

results.title: Development of speed
results.brief_description: Traces the development of style and speed in swimming through the ages. The movement of animals a bas-relief produced in 9 BC, and the crawl stroke as it has become recognized in the 20th century are studied. Details of the quick starting, racing diving, and quick turning for three well known strokes - back stroke, breast stroke, and crawl - are demonstrated.

results.title: Development of feelings in children
results.creator_credit: Donald Connors and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates how the child develops feelings, stressing that the child must be allowed to express his/her feelings freely, particularly feelings of fear, anger and hate. Aims to make parents aware of the distinction between feelings and actions, and suggests ways that parents can aid the healthy emotional development of their child.

results.title: Forward communications
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Stresses that Australia’s vast distances make an efficient system of communication most essential. Shows how the Post Office is maintaining our present communications system at a high level of efficiency and also how the heavy post-war demand for new telephones and exchanges is being met.

results.title: Developing more and better ideas
results.brief_description: A down-to-earth presentation of the process of developing ideas to help everyone, from top management to lowest rate employee, produce more and better ideas for cutting costs, increasing productivity, developing products and improving quality and performance.
